title: Child labour Laws
content:
1. Under the Ugandan law, a child is anyone under 18 years of age.  
    
 2. The Law does not prevent children from being employed or working but
    rather prohibits the type of work children can be engaged in. 

 3. Children below 12 years old cannot be employed. However, the law
    allows children between 12-14 years to do light work. Children below
    16 years cannot do work underground, such as mining, or dangerous
    work that is harmful to their health. 

 4. It is unlawful to employ children to work anytime between 7pm to 7am.
